channel.title: Refresh Rates
channel.description:
Refresh Rates
Every day I need to change my LCD screens refresh rate twice.
In the morning, my screen is set to 60Hz and it looks blurry, so I set it to 70Hz. When I get home from school, 70Hz looks blurry so I set it to 60Hz. Anyone got a reason for this?

item.title: Refresh Rates
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:3, topic:300663”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=396924.msg2947765#msg2947765 date=1252299312]
Refresh Rates

Every day I need to change my LCD screens refresh rate twice.

In the morning, my screen is set to 60Hz and it looks blurry, so I set it to 70Hz. When I get home from school, 70Hz looks blurry so I set it to 60Hz. Anyone got a reason for this?
[/quote]

Does it use DVI out, or VGA out into a DVI port ? Because Windows doesn’t really like DVI, it goes a bit fuzzy. But linux is crystal clear.[/quote]
…

Read full topic

item.title: Refresh Rates
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:1, topic:300663”]Refresh Rates

Every day I need to change my LCD screens refresh rate twice.

In the morning, my screen is set to 60Hz and it looks blurry, so I set it to 70Hz. When I get home from school, 70Hz looks blurry so I set it to 60Hz. Anyone got a reason for this?[/quote]

Does it use DVI out, or VGA out into a DVI port ? Because Windows doesn’t really like DVI, it goes a bit fuzzy. But linux is crystal clear.

Read full topic

item.title: Refresh Rates
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

LCD refresh rate never changes.
